network

Class JsonJavaRequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.RequestHandler
      • network.JsonJavaRequestHandler

  • public class JsonJavaRequestHandler
extends RequestHandler
    Verbindungsschnittstelle um Daten abzufragen. Eingabeobjekte werden verändert und zurückgeliefert. Die Verwendung der generischen Vaterklasse ermöglicht, dass clientseitig keine Cast-Befehle nötig sind. Die Schnittstelle benötigt Informationen zu den JSON Objects und der Java Objects um ein Mapping vornehmen zu können
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Steffen Baumann

        public <T extends AbstractOrganizerObject> T requestObjectByOwnId(T obj)

        Specified by:
        requestObjectByOwnId in class RequestHandler
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • registerNewUser

        public User registerNewUser(User user,
                   java.lang.String password)
        Adds new User to the database. The password is hashed, ASCII-based and Base64 encoded before it is sent to the server. With the mail address being necessary for the login it must be defined by the given User, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        registerNewUser in class RequestHandler
        Parameters:
        user - defines the main attributes of the user, that should be added
        password - plain text password for secure login
        Returns:
        the User containing its set ID or null, if such an User already exits.

      • addObject

        public <T extends AbstractOrganizerObject> T addObject(T obj)
        Adds an new object of AbstractOrganizerObject to the database.
        For adding an User use registerNewUser(User, String) instead this method.
        Specified by:
        addObject in class RequestHandler
        Parameters:
        obj - defines the main attributes of the object, that should be added.
        Returns:
        the obj containing its set ID or null, if such an object already exists.

      • removeObjectByOwnId

        public <T extends AbstractOrganizerObject> boolean removeObjectByOwnId(T obj)
        Removes an AbstractOrganizerObject from the database by using its ID.
        Specified by:
        removeObjectByOwnId in class RequestHandler
        Parameters:
        obj - the object, which should be removed by its id.
        Returns:
        true if the object was removed, false otherwise.

      • login

        public User login(java.lang.String mail,
         java.lang.String password)
        Requests a User for the given mail address and password.
        The credentials will be stored to ensure an authentication by a combination of the mail address and password.
        Specified by:
        login in class RequestHandler
        Parameters:
        mail - plain text
        password - plain text password, which will be hashed, ASCII-based and Base64 encoded for the transmission
        Returns:
        the User linked to the given credentials or null, if such a user does not exist.
